title: Leveraging AI for Positive Impact and Social Good

messages.content:
What do you think of this ai for impact workshop? I want to design it over the course of a few days and today in 1 hour i have to give the first session. Any advice?

**My Agents**
=============

**Find other networks in the Middle East similar LSE Members ‚Äì LSE (lseassociation.orgworkshop design for wellbeing for growth.take 2 workshop design for ai for impactworkshop design for ai for impactprompt creatorIdentify concept and research directionIdentify concept and research directionResearch Wellbeing for welldoingResearch Wellbeing for welldoingMake an image to describe someoneResearch peoplelanding page writerDJ ResearcherDJ for character strengthsParliments 2Parliment Appcode expertCovid Engagement ResearchDecentWork ILO For RefugeesDecentWork ILO**

**take 2 workshop design for ai for impact**

**Embarking on a new goal**Design a workshop on using ai for positive impact for ngos in the middle east. Design a three day session 2 hours each day, friday saturday and sunday. There is a lot of knowledge on https://learnprompting.org. We're going to be on zoom. Design it so it's interactive and uses virtual liberating structures principles(https://voltagecontrol.com/blog/liberating-structures-for-optimal-remote-team-communication/) or similar and gives people takeaways they can bring back to their organizations to use large language AI models to impact their work. End by creating a series of slides for each day describing each slide with text so I can make them.

**Task Added:**Design a three-day workshop session with 2 hours each day, scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. Incorporate interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles. Ensure that the workshop focuses on using large language AI models to impact their work in NGOs.

**Task Added:**Research and gather information on AI for positive impact in NGOs in the Middle East. Visit the website https://learnprompting.org to gather relevant knowledge and resources.

**Task Added:**Create a series of slides for each day of the workshop. Each slide should contain descriptive text to guide the presenter. Make sure to include the key concepts and takeaways from the workshop that participants can bring back to their organizations.

‚ú® Starting task: Research and gather information on AI for positive impact in NGOs in the Middle East. Visit the website https://learnprompting.org to gather relevant knowledge and resources.

üîç Searching the web for "AI for positive impact in NGOs in the Middle East"...

**Finished:**Research and gather information on AI for positive impact in NGOs in the Middle East. Visit the website https://learnprompting.org to gather relevant knowledge and resources.

**Executing: Research and gather information on AI for positive impact in NGOs in the Middle East. Visit the website https://learnprompting.org to gather relevant knowledge and resources.**

* * *

**Designing a Workshop on Using AI for Positive Impact for NGOs in the Middle East**
====================================================================================

**Workshop Overview**
=====================

The workshop aims to provide NGOs in the Middle East with knowledge and practical skills to leverage AI for positive impact in their work. It will be conducted over three days, with 2-hour sessions held on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. The workshop will be conducted online using Zoom, allowing participants to join remotely.

The workshop will follow an interactive approach, incorporating virtual Liberating Structures principles to encourage engagement and collaboration among participants. The goal is to equip participants with actionable takeaways that they can bring back to their organizations and implement large language AI models effectively.

**Day 1: Introduction to AI for Positive Impact**
=================================================

### Session 1: Understanding the Potential of AI in the Middle East

*   Discuss the potential of AI to disrupt markets and create innovative services and business models in the Middle East 1.
    

### Session 2: AI for Empowering NGOs

*   Explore the concept of skills-based volunteering and how businesses can enable researchers to offer pro-bono services to NGOs 2.
    

**Day 2: AI Applications in Developing Countries**
==================================================

### Session 1: Transforming Lives through AI

*   Highlight the potential of AI to transform the lives of people in developing countries 3.
    

### Session 2: Embracing AI for Economic Growth and Enhanced Lives

*   Discuss how the Middle East embraces AI's potential for economic growth, industry enhancement, and improved lives 4.
    

**Day 3: AI for Social Good**
=============================

### Session 1: Assessing the Impact of AI

*   Share recent reports on the digital economy, impact of AI on employment, income inequality, and productivity \[5\](https://www.mckinsey.com/~/media/mckinsey/featured%20insights/artificial%20intelligence/applying%20artificial%20intelligence%20for%20social
    

**Task Added:**Create a list of interactive activities and exercises for each session of the workshop.

‚ú® Starting task: Design a three-day workshop session with 2 hours each day, scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. Incorporate interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles. Ensure that the workshop focuses on using large language AI models to impact their work in NGOs.

‚è∞ Generating response...

**Finished:**Design a three-day workshop session with 2 hours each day, scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. Incorporate interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles. Ensure that the workshop focuses on using large language AI models to impact their work in NGOs.

**Executing: Design a three-day workshop session with 2 hours each day, scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. Incorporate interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles. Ensure that the workshop focuses on using large language AI models to impact their work in NGOs.**

* * *

To design a three-day workshop session on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East, scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, incorporating interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles, and focusing on the use of large language AI models to impact their work, the following steps can be followed:

1.  Understand the Problem:
    
    *   The overall objective is to design a workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East.
        
    *   The workshop should span three days with 2 hours of session time each day.
        
    *   The workshop will be conducted on Zoom.
        
    *   The workshop should be interactive and incorporate virtual liberating structures principles.
        
    *   The aim is to provide participants with takeaways they can implement in their organizations.
        
2.  Extract Variables:
    
    *   Duration: Three days, 2 hours each day
        
    *   Target Audience: NGOs in the Middle East
        
    *   Platform: Zoom
        
    *   Workshop Focus: Using large language AI models to impact NGO work
        
    *   Interactive Elements: Virtual liberating structures principles
        
3.  Design the Workshop: Day 1:
    
    *   Introduction to AI and its potential for positive impact in NGOs.
        
    *   Overview of large language AI models and their applications.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Breakout rooms for participants to discuss challenges and opportunities in their organizations.
        
    
    Day 2:
    
    *   Deep dive into specific use cases of AI in NGOs.
        
    *   Practical exercises: Participants work in groups to brainstorm and develop potential AI solutions for their organizations.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Virtual Liberating Structure - "1-2-4-All" to encourage collaboration and idea sharing.
        
    
    Day 3:
    
    *   Ethical considerations when using AI in NGOs.
        
    *   Best practices for implementing large language AI models in organizations.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Virtual Liberating Structure - "Wise Crowds" to gather collective insights and feedback on participants' AI solution ideas.
        
4.  Create Takeaways:
    
    *   Provide participants with a set of resources and documentation on the use of large language AI models.
        
    *   Share practical examples and case studies for reference.
        
    *   Offer guidance on how to integrate AI solutions into their organizations.
        
    *   Provide a template or framework for participants to develop an action plan for implementing AI in their NGO work.
        
5.  Create Slides for Each Day:
    
    *   Introduction slides: Introduce the workshop objectives, agenda, and facilitators.
        
    *   Content slides: Cover the main topics for each
        

‚ú® Starting task: Create a series of slides for each day of the workshop. Each slide should contain descriptive text to guide the presenter. Make sure to include the key concepts and takeaways from the workshop that participants can bring back to their organizations.

‚è∞ Generating response...

**Executing: Create a series of slides for each day of the workshop. Each slide should contain descriptive text to guide the presenter. Make sure to include the key concepts and takeaways from the workshop that participants can bring back to their organizations.**

* * *

To design a series of slides for each day of the workshop, we need to consider the given objective of designing a workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East. The workshop will span across three days, with two hours allocated each day (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday). The workshop will be conducted on Zoom, and we aim to make it interactive using virtual liberating structures principles or similar approaches. The main goal is to provide participants with takeaways they can bring back to their organizations to utilize large language AI models effectively.

Here is a detailed breakdown of the slides for each day:

Day 1:

1.  Introduction:
    
    *   Welcome participants and provide a brief overview of the workshop.
        
    *   Present the overall objective and the importance of using AI for positive impact in NGO work.
        
    *   Highlight the significance of language AI models in achieving this objective.
        
2.  Key Concepts:
    
    *   Explain the basics of AI and its potential applications in the NGO sector.
        
    *   Introduce different types of AI models, focusing on large language models.
        
    *   Discuss how AI can be leveraged to address challenges faced by NGOs in the Middle East.
        
3.  Virtual Liberating Structures:
    
    *   Present an overview of virtual liberating structures principles (reference: https://voltagecontrol.com/blog/liberating-structures-for-optimal-remote-team-communication/).
        
    *   Explain how these principles can enhance participant engagement and interaction during the workshop.
        
    *   Provide examples of liberating structures that will be used during the session.
        
4.  Interactive Activities:
    
    *   Include slides that guide participants through interactive activities, such as breakout discussions, polls, or collaborative exercises.
        
    *   Emphasize the importance of active participation and sharing of ideas.
        
5.  Wrap-up and Takeaways:
    
    *   Summarize the key concepts covered during the session.
        
    *   Provide participants with tangible takeaways they can implement in their organizations.
        
    *   Encourage participants to think about how they can apply language AI models to positively impact their work.
        

Day 2:

1.  Recap and Agenda:
    
    *   Start with a brief recap of the previous day's session.
        
    *   Present the agenda for the current day, highlighting the topics to be covered.
        
2.  AI in NGO Work:
    
    *   Discuss specific use cases of AI in the NGO sector, focusing on success stories from the Middle East.
        
    *   Highlight the benefits and challenges associated with implementing AI in NGO work.
        
    *   Provide examples of how language AI models
        

**Finished:**Create a series of slides for each day of the workshop. Each slide should contain descriptive text to guide the presenter. Make sure to include the key concepts and takeaways from the workshop that participants can bring back to their organizations.

**Task Added:**Create a list of icebreaker activities for the beginning of each session of the workshop.

‚ú® Starting task: Create a list of interactive activities and exercises for each session of the workshop.

‚è∞ Generating response...

**Executing: Create a list of interactive activities and exercises for each session of the workshop.**

* * *

To create a list of interactive activities and exercises for each session of the workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East, we need to consider the objectives of the workshop, the virtual setting on Zoom, and the desire to use virtual liberating structures principles. Below is a breakdown of interactive activities and exercises for each session:

Session 1: Friday (2 hours) Objective: Introduce participants to the concept of AI and its potential for positive impact on NGO work.

1.  Icebreaker: Begin the session with an icebreaker activity to foster engagement and connection among participants. For example, ask each participant to briefly introduce themselves and share one challenge they face in their NGO work.
    
2.  Presentation: Deliver a presentation on the basics of AI, including definitions, types of AI, and examples of AI applications in the NGO sector. Use visual aids and include opportunities for participants to ask questions and engage in discussions.
    
3.  Case Study Analysis: Divide participants into small breakout rooms and provide them with a case study related to an NGO in the Middle East that successfully implemented AI for positive impact. In their groups, they should analyze the case study, discuss the challenges faced, and identify the potential benefits and lessons learned.
    
4.  Group Discussion: Bring participants back to the main session and facilitate a group discussion based on the case study analysis. Encourage participants to share their insights, ask questions, and exchange ideas on how AI can be applied to their own organizations.
    
5.  Interactive Activity: Use virtual liberating structures principles by conducting a "1-2-4-All" activity. Pose a question related to AI and ask participants to reflect individually for one minute. Then, pair them up to discuss their thoughts for two minutes. Afterward, group pairs together in fours to share their collective ideas for four minutes. Finally, ask each group to share the key takeaways from their discussions with the whole workshop.
    

Session 2: Saturday (2 hours) Objective: Explore the use of large language AI models and their potential impact on NGO work.

1.  Recap and Reflection: Begin the session by briefly summarizing the key points from the previous session and inviting participants to share any insights or questions that arose after further reflection.
    
2.  Expert Panel Discussion: Invite experts in the field of AI and language models to join a panel discussion on the applications and challenges of using large language AI models in the NGO sector. Allow participants to submit questions in advance or ask them live during the session.
    

**Finished:**Create a list of interactive activities and exercises for each session of the workshop.

**Task Added:**Create a list of discussion questions for the group activity in Session 2 of the workshop.

‚ú® Starting task: Create a list of icebreaker activities for the beginning of each session of the workshop.

‚è∞ Generating response...

**Finished:**Create a list of icebreaker activities for the beginning of each session of the workshop.

**Executing: Create a list of icebreaker activities for the beginning of each session of the workshop.**

* * *

Based on the given overall objective of designing a workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East, and considering the format of a three-day session with 2 hours each day (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday) on Zoom, the task is to create a list of icebreaker activities for the beginning of each session of the workshop.

Icebreaker activities are essential to create a positive and interactive environment, allowing participants to get to know each other and feel comfortable engaging in the workshop. Here are some suggested icebreaker activities for each session:

Session 1 (Friday):

1.  Two Truths and a Lie: Each participant shares two true statements and one false statement about themselves. The others then guess which statement is the lie.
    
2.  This or That: Present a series of choices (e.g., coffee or tea, mountains or beach) and ask participants to quickly choose their preference. They can briefly explain why they made their choice.
    
3.  Virtual Scavenger Hunt: Provide a list of items or concepts related to AI or NGOs. Participants search their surroundings and show the item or concept on their webcam. They can briefly explain the connection.
    

Session 2 (Saturday):

1.  Share Your Superpower: Each participant shares a unique skill or talent they possess and explain how it can be applied to AI or NGOs.
    
2.  Emoji Introductions: Ask participants to introduce themselves using only emojis. They can choose emojis that represent their name, profession, or interests.
    
3.  Picture Perfect: Share a thought-provoking image related to AI or NGO work. Participants take turns describing what they see, how it relates to the workshop, or how it inspires them.
    

Session 3 (Sunday):

1.  Memory Chain: Start with one participant sharing a word related to AI or NGOs. The next participant adds another word that starts with the last letter of the previous word. Continue the chain until everyone has contributed.
    
2.  Quiz Time: Prepare a short quiz with multiple-choice questions about AI and its impact on NGOs. Participants can use the chat function to submit their answers, and discuss the correct answers together afterwards.
    
3.  Personal Impact Stories: Each participant shares a personal anecdote or experience where AI has made a positive impact on their work or organization. This encourages reflection and inspires others.
    

By incorporating these icebreaker activities, participants will have the opportunity to connect, engage, and contribute their own ideas and experiences. These activities promote a collaborative and interactive workshop atmosphere, setting the stage for

**Task Added:**Create a list of interactive activities for each day of the workshop that promote engagement and learning about large language AI models and their impact on NGO work.

‚ú® Starting task: Create a list of discussion questions for the group activity in Session 2 of the workshop.

There is a lot of knowledge on https://learnprompting.org. We're going to be on zoom. Design it so it's interactive and uses virtual liberating structures principles(https://voltagecontrol.com/blog/liberating-structures-for-optimal-remote-team-communication/) or similar and gives people takeaways they can bring back to their organizations to use large language AI models to impact their work. End by creating a series of slides for each day describing each slide with text so I can make them.**

* * *

**Designing a Workshop on Using AI for Positive Impact for NGOs in the Middle East**
====================================================================================

**Workshop Overview**
=====================

The workshop aims to provide NGOs in the Middle East with knowledge and practical skills to leverage AI for positive impact in their work. It will be conducted over three days, with 2-hour sessions held on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. The workshop will be conducted online using Zoom, allowing participants to join remotely. The workshop will follow an interactive approach, incorporating virtual Liberating Structures principles to encourage engagement and collaboration among participants. The goal is to equip participants with actionable takeaways that they can bring back to their organizations and implement large language AI models effectively.

**Day 1: Introduction to AI for Positive Impact**
=================================================

### Session 1: Understanding the Potential of AI in the Middle East

*   Discuss the potential of AI to disrupt markets and create innovative services and business models in the Middle East 1.
    

### Session 2: AI for Empowering NGOs

*   Explore the concept of skills-based volunteering and how businesses can enable researchers to offer pro-bono services to NGOs 2.
    

**Day 2: AI Applications in Developing Countries**
==================================================

### Session 1: Transforming Lives through AI

*   Highlight the potential of AI to transform the lives of people in developing countries 3.
    

### Session 2: Embracing AI for Economic Growth and Enhanced Lives

*   Discuss how the Middle East embraces AI's potential for economic growth, industry enhancement, and improved lives 4.
    

**Day 3: AI for Social Good**
=============================

### Session 1: Assessing the Impact of AI

*   Share recent reports on the digital economy, impact of AI on employment, income inequality, and productivity 5
    

To design a three-day workshop session on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East, scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, incorporating interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles, and focusing on the use of large language AI models to impact their work, the following steps can be followed:

1.  Understand the Problem:
    
    *   The overall objective is to design a workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East.
        
    *   The workshop should span three days with 2 hours of session time each day.
        
    *   The workshop will be conducted on Zoom.
        
    *   The workshop should be interactive and incorporate virtual liberating structures principles.
        
    *   The aim is to provide participants with takeaways they can implement in their organizations.
        
2.  Extract Variables:
    
    *   Duration: Three days, 2 hours each day
        
    *   Target Audience: NGOs in the Middle East
        
    *   Platform: Zoom
        
    *   Workshop Focus: Using large language AI models to impact NGO work
        
    *   Interactive Elements: Virtual liberating structures principles
        
3.  Design the Workshop: Day 1:
    
    *   Introduction to AI and its potential for positive impact in NGOs.
        
    *   Overview of large language AI models and their applications.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Breakout rooms for participants to discuss challenges and opportunities in their organizations.
        
    
    Day 2:
    
    *   Deep dive into specific use cases of AI in NGOs.
        
    *   Practical exercises: Participants work in groups to brainstorm and develop potential AI solutions for their organizations.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Virtual Liberating Structure - "1-2-4-All" to encourage collaboration and idea sharing.
        
    
    Day 3:
    
    *   Ethical considerations when using AI in NGOs.
        
    *   Best practices for implementing large language AI models in organizations.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Virtual Liberating Structure - "Wise Crowds" to gather collective insights and feedback on participants' AI solution ideas.
        
4.  Create Takeaways:
    
    *   Provide participants with a set of resources and documentation on the use of large language AI models.
        
    *   Share practical examples and case studies for reference.
        
    *   Offer guidance on how to integrate AI solutions into their organizations.
        
    *   Provide a template or framework for participants to develop an action plan for implementing AI in their NGO work.
        
5.  Create Slides for Each Day:
    
    *   Introduction slides: Introduce the workshop objectives, agenda, and facilitators.
        
    *   Content slides: Cover the main topics for each session, including the potential of AI in the Middle East, AI for empowering NGOs, AI applications in developing countries, embracing AI for economic growth and enhanced lives, and assessing the impact of AI.
        
    *   Interactive activity slides: Include slides that guide participants through interactive activities such as breakout discussions, practical exercises, and virtual Liberating Structure activities.
        
    *   Takeaway slides: Summarize the key points and provide participants with tangible takeaways they can implement in their organizations.
        

By following these steps, a workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East can be designed effectively, incorporating interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles to engage participants and provide actionable takeaways.

**Executing: Response for 'can you make slides for friday, sat, and sunday going into the steps described in the workshop you created?'**

* * *

Slide 4:

    *   Encourage participants

The workshop will span across three days, with two hours allocated each day (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday).     *   Encourage participants to think about how they can apply language AI models to positively impact their work.

* * *

To create a list of interactive activities and exercises for each session of the workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East, we need to consider the objectives of the workshop, the virtual setting on Zoom, and the desire to use virtual liberating structures principles. Below is a breakdown of interactive activities and exercises for each session:

Session 1: Friday (2 hours) Objective: Introduce participants to the concept of AI and its potential for positive impact on NGO work.

1.  Icebreaker: Begin the session with an icebreaker activity to foster engagement and connection among participants. For example, ask each participant to briefly introduce themselves and share one challenge they face in their NGO work.
    
2.  Presentation: Deliver a presentation on the basics of AI, including definitions, types of AI, and examples of AI applications in the NGO sector. Use visual aids and include opportunities for participants to ask questions and engage in discussions.
    
3.  Case Study Analysis: Divide participants into small breakout rooms and provide them with a case study related to an NGO in the Middle East that successfully implemented AI for positive impact. In their groups, they should analyze the case study, discuss the challenges faced, and identify the potential benefits and lessons learned.
    
4.  Group Discussion: Bring participants back to the main session and facilitate a group discussion based on the case study analysis. Encourage participants to share their insights, ask questions, and exchange ideas on how AI can be applied to their own organizations.
    
5.  Interactive Activity: Use virtual liberating structures principles by conducting a "1-2-4-All" activity. Pose a question related to AI and ask participants to reflect individually for one minute. Then, pair them up to discuss their thoughts for two minutes. Afterward, group pairs together in fours to share their collective ideas for four minutes. Finally, ask each group to share the key takeaways from their discussions with the whole workshop.
    

Session 2: Saturday (2 hours) Objective: Explore the use of large language AI models and their potential impact on NGO work.

1.  Recap and Reflection: Begin the session by briefly summarizing the key points from the previous session and inviting participants to share any insights or questions that arose after further reflection.
    
2.  Expert Panel Discussion: Invite experts in the field of AI and language models to join a panel discussion on the applications and challenges of using large language AI models in the NGO sector. Allow participants to submit questions in advance or ask them live during the session.
    

**Finished:**Create a list of interactive activities and exercises for each session of the workshop.

* * *

Based on the given overall objective of designing a workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East, and considering the format of a three-day session with 2 hours each day (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday) on Zoom, the task is to create a list of icebreaker activities for the beginning of each session of the workshop.

Icebreaker activities are essential to create a positive and interactive environment, allowing participants to get to know each other and feel comfortable engaging in the workshop. Here are some suggested icebreaker activities for each session:

Session 1 (Friday):

1.  Two Truths and a Lie: Each participant shares two true statements and one false statement about themselves. The others then guess which statement is the lie.
    
2.  This or That: Present a series of choices (e.g., coffee or tea, mountains or beach) and ask participants to quickly choose their preference. They can briefly explain why they made their choice.
    
3.  Virtual Scavenger Hunt: Provide a list of items or concepts related to AI or NGOs. Participants search their surroundings and show the item or concept on their webcam. They can briefly explain the connection.
    

Session 2 (Saturday):

1.  Share Your Superpower: Each participant shares a unique skill or talent they possess and explain how it can be applied to AI or NGOs.
    
2.  Emoji Introductions: Ask participants to introduce themselves using only emojis. They can choose emojis that represent their name, profession, or interests.
    
3.  Picture Perfect: Share a thought-provoking image related to AI or NGO work. Participants take turns describing what they see, how it relates to the workshop, or how it inspires them.
    

Session 3 (Sunday):

1.  Memory Chain: Start with one participant sharing a word related to AI or NGOs. The next participant adds another word that starts with the last letter of the previous word. Continue the chain until everyone has contributed.
    
2.  Quiz Time: Prepare a short quiz with multiple-choice questions about AI and its impact on NGOs. Participants can use the chat function to submit their answers, and discuss the correct answers together afterwards.
    
3.  Personal Impact Stories: Each participant shares a personal anecdote or experience where AI has made a positive impact on their work or organization. This encourages reflection and inspires others.
    

By incorporating these icebreaker activities, participants will have the opportunity to connect, engage, and contribute their own ideas and experiences. These activities promote a collaborative and interactive workshop atmosphere, setting the stage for

End by creating a series of slides for each day describing each slide with text so I can make them.**

* * *

**Designing a Workshop on Using AI for Positive Impact for NGOs in the Middle East**
====================================================================================

**Workshop Overview**
=====================

The workshop aims to provide NGOs in the Middle East with knowledge and practical skills to leverage AI for positive impact in their work. It will be conducted over three days, with 2-hour sessions held on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. The workshop will be conducted online using Zoom, allowing participants to join remotely. The workshop will follow an interactive approach, incorporating virtual Liberating Structures principles to encourage engagement and collaboration among participants. The goal is to equip participants with actionable takeaways that they can bring back to their organizations and implement large language AI models effectively.

**Day 1: Introduction to AI for Positive Impact**
=================================================

### Session 1: Understanding the Potential of AI in the Middle East

*   Discuss the potential of AI to disrupt markets and create innovative services and business models in the Middle East 1.
    

### Session 2: AI for Empowering NGOs

*   Explore the concept of skills-based volunteering and how businesses can enable researchers to offer pro-bono services to NGOs 2.
    

**Day 2: AI Applications in Developing Countries**
==================================================

### Session 1: Transforming Lives through AI

*   Highlight the potential of AI to transform the lives of people in developing countries 3.
    

### Session 2: Embracing AI for Economic Growth and Enhanced Lives

*   Discuss how the Middle East embraces AI's potential for economic growth, industry enhancement, and improved lives 4.
    

**Day 3: AI for Social Good**
=============================

### Session 1: Assessing the Impact of AI

*   Share recent reports on the digital economy, impact of AI on employment, income inequality, and productivity 5
    

To design a three-day workshop session on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East, scheduled for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, incorporating interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles, and focusing on the use of large language AI models to impact their work, the following steps can be followed:

1.  Understand the Problem:
    
    *   The overall objective is to design a workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East.
        
    *   The workshop should span three days with 2 hours of session time each day.
        
    *   The workshop will be conducted on Zoom.
        
    *   The workshop should be interactive and incorporate virtual liberating structures principles.
        
    *   The aim is to provide participants with takeaways they can implement in their organizations.
        
2.  Extract Variables:
    
    *   Duration: Three days, 2 hours each day
        
    *   Target Audience: NGOs in the Middle East
        
    *   Platform: Zoom
        
    *   Workshop Focus: Using large language AI models to impact NGO work
        
    *   Interactive Elements: Virtual liberating structures principles
        
3.  Design the Workshop: Day 1:
    
    *   Introduction to AI and its potential for positive impact in NGOs.
        
    *   Overview of large language AI models and their applications.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Breakout rooms for participants to discuss challenges and opportunities in their organizations.
        
    
    Day 2:
    
    *   Deep dive into specific use cases of AI in NGOs.
        
    *   Practical exercises: Participants work in groups to brainstorm and develop potential AI solutions for their organizations.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Virtual Liberating Structure - "1-2-4-All" to encourage collaboration and idea sharing.
        
    
    Day 3:
    
    *   Ethical considerations when using AI in NGOs.
        
    *   Best practices for implementing large language AI models in organizations.
        
    *   Interactive activity: Virtual Liberating Structure - "Wise Crowds" to gather collective insights and feedback on participants' AI solution ideas.
        
4.  Create Takeaways:
    
    *   Provide participants with a set of resources and documentation on the use of large language AI models.
        
    *   Share practical examples and case studies for reference.
        
    *   Offer guidance on how to integrate AI solutions into their organizations.
        
    *   Provide a template or framework for participants to develop an action plan for implementing AI in their NGO work.
        
5.  Create Slides for Each Day:
    
    *   Introduction slides: Introduce the workshop objectives, agenda, and facilitators.
        
    *   Content slides: Cover the main topics for each session, including the potential of AI in the Middle East, AI for empowering NGOs, AI applications in developing countries, embracing AI for economic growth and enhanced lives, and assessing the impact of AI.
        
    *   Interactive activity slides: Include slides that guide participants through interactive activities such as breakout discussions, practical exercises, and virtual Liberating Structure activities.
        
    *   Takeaway slides: Summarize the key points and provide participants with tangible takeaways they can implement in their organizations.
        

By following these steps, a workshop on using AI for positive impact for NGOs in the Middle East can be designed effectively, incorporating interactive elements and virtual liberating structures principles to engage participants and provide actionable takeaways.
